content.description:
Climbs the flared crack/groove just right of

Cat In The Hat

via a couple of jams and the featured arete out right to a large ledge and finishes with the crux moves of

Cat In The Hat

.

* Theodor Geisel was better known as Dr. Seuss.
content.protection:
TR from anchors atop

Cat In The Hat
content.location:
Located immediately right of

Cat In The Hat

.

content.description:
Starts left of

The Lorax

at the left side of a curving arch/roof. Lieback and then undercling out right (clip the 1st bolt of The Lorax) to eventually join

Horton Hears A Who

and finish up that route to anchors.
content.location: Far left side of the southwest face, just left of The Lorax.

content.description:
Climb up the face on good crimps and sidepulls until below the overlap (1st bolt). It is possible to pre clip the first bolt from the nearby boulder.

Passing the first bolt provides a nice sequence of moves on small holds. Continue up the steep face until moves past the 3rd bolt allow the finishing slab to be reached.
content.location: 1st bolted route in from the left on the South West Face.

content.description:
Lieback the left edge of the flake/roof, utilizing a key left foot edge, power up the plated face to a fun mantel then romp up slab to the anchors shared with

The Lorax

.

Climb "alligator skin" face with a thin crack (optional pro to 1") to a ledge and clip a high first bolt. Stem upwards, make some tricky moves past the 2nd bolt (crux) and then finish up fun plated rock and a short bit of slab to the anchors.

Originally done without bolts, it was bolted a few years later not knowing it had been previously done. If skipping the bolts you'll want several large (5-6") pieces.
content.location:
Located just right of

The Lorax

and easily identified as a wide crack/groove system.

climbs.name: Green Eggs and Ham
climbs.fa: John Cardmon and Brad Singer, September 1998

content.description:
Lieback a featured arete to a ledge below a flared corner system which is jammed/chimneyed/stemmed to another ledge and finish up a mossy groove crack.

* It's also possible to cut left from the second ledge to anchors atop

Cat In The Hat

via an exposed but thrilling face sequence.
content.location:
Located 10 feet right of

Cat In The Hat

.

content.description:
The climb starts fast. Using small crimps and sidepulls climb up to and past the first bolt. Continue in a similar vein to the 2nd bolt where the difficulties ease.

Continue to the rounded overhang. The crux is gaining a standing position above the overhang, after which the top is soon reached.
content.location: Right side of the South West Face
